sentence.text: We aimed to test effects of such gCNVs on the risk of lung cancer and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (intracellular protein transport).

Genomic imbalance of lung cancer was determined by the array comparative genomic hybridization (aCGH), and common gCNVs at these imbalance regions were genotyped in lung cancer-based and intracellular protein transport-based retrospective studies.

The CNVR_3425.1, overlapping the chr16q24.1 with genomic imbalance, was significantly associated with increased risks of lung cancer (OR = 1.76; 95% CI = 1.46-2.11) and intracellular protein transport (OR = 1.98; 95% CI = 1.57-2.51).

The increase copy of CNVR_3425.1 forms a new additional truncated positive regulation of transcription, DNA-templated adjacent non-coding developmental regulatory RNA (FENDRR) sequences comparing the gene promoter and perturbs the transcriptional factors (TFs) binding to the original FENDRR promoter and further downregulates FENDRR, a long intergenic non-coding RNA (lincRNA) that functions to inhibit lung cancer by affecting expressions of an abundant number of genes, including the tumor suppressor FOXF1.
